page.title: 08BUILDINGS
page.content: IN MOOR MONKTON THE PARISH CHURCH OF ALL SAINTS IS IN THE S.W. CORNER OF CHURCH FIELD. THE FOUNDATION IS LATE 11TH CENTURY.STONE BUILT IT WAS THE CHURCH OF AN OLD ECCLESIASTIC AND CIVIL PARISH AND WAS RESTORED IN 1897. THERE IS A WINDOW DESIGNIED BY BURNE- JONES. IN NUN MONKTON THE CHURCH OF ST MARY,BUILT ON THE SITE OF ONE SACKED BY THE DANES IN AD 867, IS THE ONLY SURVIVAL ABOVE GROUND OF THE MEDIEVAL NUNNERY. FOUNDATIONS OF OTHER PARTS HAVE BEEN EXCAVATED. NOTEWORTHY ARE THE MAGNIFICENT WEST DOORWAY AND THE INTERIOR ARCHITECTURE. A FORMER HALL BELONGED TO THE PERCY FAMILY. THIS WAS REPLACED BY THE PRESENT WILLIAM AND MARY STYLE,1690, IN RED BRICK AND ASHLAR WHICH WAS MODERNISED IN 1929. NUN MONKTON C.OF E. SCHOOL ENDOWED AS A CHARITY IN 1776 FOR TWELVE BOYS IS NOW UNDER THREAT OF CLOSURE.
